data.value: This method takes a
key
argument to select data at a particular level of a MultiIndex.
xs
can not be used to set values.
MultiIndex Slicers is a generic way to get/set values on any level or levels. It is a superset of
xs
functionality, see
Label contained in the index, or partially in a MultiIndex.
Axis to retrieve cross-section on.
In case of a key partially contained in a MultiIndex, indicate which levels are used. Levels can be referred by label or position.

children.type_: object, defaults to first n levels (n=1 or len(key))

data.value: If False, returns object with same levels as self.
Cross-section from the original Series or DataFrame corresponding to the selected index levels.
Return cross-section from the Series/DataFrame.
d
d

data.out:
num_legs  num_wings
class  animal  locomotion
mammal cat     walks              4          0
       dog     walks              4          0
       bat     flies              2          2
bird   penguin walks              2          2

data.value: Get values at specified index

data.out:
num_legs  num_wings
animal locomotion
cat    walks              4          0
dog    walks              4          0
bat    flies              2          2

data.value: Get values at several indexes
Get values at specified index and level

class  locomotion

data.value: Get values at several indexes and levels
Get values at specified column and axis

data.out:
class   animal   locomotion
mammal  cat      walks         0
        dog      walks         0
        bat      flies         2
bird    penguin  walks         2
Name: num_wings, dtype: int64

data.value: Access a group of rows and columns by label(s) or a boolean array.
Purely integer-location based indexing for selection by position.

signature.value: xs(self, key, axis=0, level=None, drop_level: 'bool_t' = True)
